instruction: In a large vessel, bring ample water to a boil. Add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, green cardamoms, cloves, star anise, black cumin seeds, and salt.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: Now add 8 green cardamoms and 6 cloves. Then add ginger garlic paste. Cook the paste really well to remove the raw smell.
Now add red chili powder – keep stirring well. (Note: The line repeats "aloo chili powder" – likely a mis-speak of "lal mirch" (red chili)).
Turn the flame low. Add 200 grams of whisked curd/yogurt. Stir it gently and let it cook nicely.
Now add a pinch of mace powder, half a teaspoon cardamom powder, and a pinch of nutmeg powder. Mix it all in gently. When you see a nice sheen in the chicken, move to the next step.
Cook it for a while until the chicken is 80–90% cooked – no more than that. As you can see, the chicken is beautifully cooked now. And the gravy you see here is very important.
Now we strain the yakhni (stock). Look at this – it smells amazing! Use a strainer to collect all the aromatic yakhni into a bowl.
Now extract the 'rogan' (flavored oil/fat). Do this as I’m showing you – collect it in a bowl. Then add 2 tablespoons of ghee into the rogan, mix it well, and keep it aside. We’ll use it later.
Now add cinnamon powder, a pinch of mace powder, half teaspoon cardamom powder, a pinch of nutmeg, 1 tbsp kewra water, 1 tbsp rose water, 100g milk, and 100g fresh cream. Mix this well.
Now add 5–6 liters of water in a large vessel. Add 8–10 green cardamoms, 2 cinnamon sticks, 2 bay leaves, 7–8 cloves, and at least 3–4 tablespoons of salt.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water and cook until the grains are about 70% done—firm with a slight bite.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 3

transcript_segments.text: Add plenty of salt – it's important. Then add 4 tablespoons of desi ghee. While the water is heating, strain the soaked rice. Once the water is boiling, squeeze the juice of a lemon into it.

instruction: Drain the rice immediately to prevent overcooking and spread it out to cool slightly.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 4

transcript_segments.text: You can now remove the whole spices if you prefer, or leave them in – your choice. Now turn the flame high and boil the rice. Our rice is now cooked properly.
Now lift the pot and strain all the rice thoroughly as shown. Take the vessel in which you'll layer the biryani. Add 2 tablespoons of ghee and coat the bottom.
